page.title: 11Home Life in Eccleshall
page.content: Most Eccleshall families have comfort- able, well-equipped houses with small gardens. Many keep pets for the children. The mother's day is usually geared to the comings and goings of the children to school or local act- ivities, when they often need taking either by car or on foot. Most have the usual labour-saving devices in the home, the most recent addition being the microwave oven. With this and the wide availability of convenience foods preparation time for meals can be greatly reduced. Leisure activities - mostly in the evenings - are well supported. House decoration and main- tenance occupy the men to a large extent. Perhaps more time is spent watching television than on any other leisure activity, particularly as many families now possess a video recorder.
